title: How to Make Brownie Pizza

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: Set your oven to 325°F (163°C). Generally, you can expect your oven to finish heating in 10 to 15 minutes, though times may vary depending on your oven. To make the most of your time, begin preparing your brownie mix while the oven is preheating.

steps.headline: Prepare your brownie mix.
steps.description: Depending on your mix, this process may vary. Follow the box or package instructions for the best results. In most cases, this involves mixing oil, eggs, and water with the brownie mix in a bowl. Whisk all the ingredients together until the mixture is consistent throughout.

steps.headline: Pour the mix onto a pizza pan.
steps.description: Coat a round pizza pan with non-stick cooking spray. Position the bowl with your batter mixture over the pan. Use a wooden spoon to push the batter onto the pan. Spread the batter with the spoon so it forms an even layer.

steps.headline: Bake the brownie.
steps.description: At this point, your oven should be finished preheating. Insert your pizza pan into the oven. Bake the brownie for about 16 to 20 minutes. When the brownie is firm and its edges are hard, the brownie is ready to be removed from the oven. Remove the brownie and allow it to cool completely. Be sure you use safety implements, like an oven mitt or a potholder, to prevent burns when removing the pan.

steps.headline: Frost the brownie and add toppings.
steps.description: Use an offset spatula, knife, or spoon to spread your frosting on top of the brownie. Spread the frosting in an even layer. On top of the frosting, spread your chocolate wafer candies and peanut butter cups.

steps.headline: Drizzle fudge and caramel on the brownie and enjoy.
steps.description: Follow the directions on the label of your fudge and caramel to heat them. Use a spoon to drizzle the fudge and caramel over the top of the brownie. Cut the brownie pizza into wedges with a knife and enjoy. If you plan on saving your brownie pizza for later, cover it and keep it in the refrigerator. Doing so will keep it good for about 3 to 4 days.

steps.headline: Use candy as a topping for your pizza.
steps.description: Add other toppings to personalize the brownie pizza according to your taste. Sprinkles, nuts, M&M’s, and even cut up candy bars, like Kit-Kats and Snickers bars, make delicious toppers.

steps.headline: Chop nuts and sprinkle them on top of your brownie pizza.
steps.description: Use a knife to roughly chop your favorite nuts, like pecans, peanuts, cashews, and so on. Alternatively, Use a food processor to chop the nuts. Spread the nuts over the pizza and enjoy. Nut allergies are fairly common. Be sure you inform people there are nuts on the brownie pizza before they partake.

steps.headline: Melt white chocolate and drizzle it over your pizza.
steps.description: Add white chocolate to a microwave safe dish. Microwave the chocolate for 30-second intervals, stirring the chocolate in between intervals. When the chocolate is smooth throughout, drizzle it over the top of your pizza. White chocolate shavings are another option for a brownie pizza topping. Scatter these shavings across the top of the pizza.

steps.headline: Sprinkle shredded coconut on top of your pizza.
steps.description: Before doing this, consider the tastes of those you’ll be serving. Some may not appreciate coconut as much as you do, so you may want to only sprinkle it over one half of the pizza.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: Set your oven to 350°F (176°C) if you’re using a normal pizza pan or 325°F (163°C) if you’re using one that is dark or non-stick. Preheating generally takes 10 to 15 minutes, though this time may vary depending on your oven.

steps.headline: Prepare the brownie mix.
steps.description: For the best result, follow the package directions to prepare the mix. Usually this combining the brownie mix with oil, eggs, and water in a bowl. Stir these ingredients thoroughly with a whisk until the mixture is consistent throughout.

steps.headline: Pour the mix into a round pizza pan.
steps.description: Coat the bottom of your pizza pan with non-stick cooking spray or shortening. Pour the brownie mix into the pan. Use a wooden spoon to scrape mix remnants from the bowl to the pan. Spread the mix in an even layer.

steps.headline: Bake the brownie.
steps.description: Insert the pan into your preheated oven. Bake the brownie for 25 to 28 minutes. As the baking time nears its end, check the brownie by sticking a toothpick into it 2 in (5 cm) from the edge of the pan. If the toothpick comes out nearly clean, the brownies are ready.

steps.headline: Combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: In a small mixing bowl, add the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla. Blend these ingredients with an electric mixer set to medium speed. Beat the ingredients with the mixer until it is smooth.

steps.headline: Top your pizza with the cream cheese spread and berries.
steps.description: With an offset spatula or a knife, scoop the cream cheese mixture out of the bowl and layer it on top of the brownie. Spread the berries on top of the cream cheese mixture.

steps.headline: Brush apple jelly on the berries and enjoy.
steps.description: Stir the apple jelly until it is smooth. Use a cooking brush to paint the berries with the jelly. Insert the brownie into the refrigerator for about an hour or until it is cool to the touch. Cut the brownie pizza into wedges and enjoy. Cover your brownie pizza and store it in your refrigerator. This desert should last about 3 to 4 days before going bad.

text: Baking the Brownie Preheat your oven. Set your oven to 325°F (163°C). Generally, you can expect your oven to finish heating in 10 to 15 minutes, though times may vary depending on your oven. To make the most of your time, begin preparing your brownie mix while the oven is preheating. Prepare your brownie mix. Depending on your mix, this process may vary. Follow the box or package instructions for the best results. In most cases, this involves mixing oil, eggs, and water with the brownie mix in a bowl. Whisk all the ingredients together until the mixture is consistent throughout. Pour the mix onto a pizza pan. Coat a round pizza pan with non-stick cooking spray. Position the bowl with your batter mixture over the pan. Use a wooden spoon to push the batter onto the pan. Spread the batter with the spoon so it forms an even layer. Bake the brownie. At this point, your oven should be finished preheating. Insert your pizza pan into the oven. Bake the brownie for about 16 to 20 minutes. When the brownie is firm and its edges are hard, the brownie is ready to be removed from the oven. Remove the brownie and allow it to cool completely. Be sure you use safety implements, like an oven mitt or a potholder, to prevent burns when removing the pan. Adding Sauce and Toppings Frost the brownie and add toppings. Use an offset spatula, knife, or spoon to spread your frosting on top of the brownie. Spread the frosting in an even layer. On top of the frosting, spread your chocolate wafer candies and peanut butter cups. Drizzle fudge and caramel on the brownie and enjoy. Follow the directions on the label of your fudge and caramel to heat them. Use a spoon to drizzle the fudge and caramel over the top of the brownie. Cut the brownie pizza into wedges with a knife and enjoy. If you plan on saving your brownie pizza for later, cover it and keep it in the refrigerator. Doing so will keep it good for about 3 to 4 days. Use candy as a topping for your pizza. Add other toppings to personalize the brownie pizza according to your taste. Sprinkles, nuts, M&M’s, and even cut up candy bars, like Kit-Kats and Snickers bars, make delicious toppers. Chop nuts and sprinkle them on top of your brownie pizza. Use a knife to roughly chop your favorite nuts, like pecans, peanuts, cashews, and so on. Alternatively, Use a food processor to chop the nuts. Spread the nuts over the pizza and enjoy. Nut allergies are fairly common. Be sure you inform people there are nuts on the brownie pizza before they partake. Melt white chocolate and drizzle it over your pizza. Add white chocolate to a microwave safe dish. Microwave the chocolate for 30-second intervals, stirring the chocolate in between intervals. When the chocolate is smooth throughout, drizzle it over the top of your pizza. White chocolate shavings are another option for a brownie pizza topping. Scatter these shavings across the top of the pizza. Sprinkle shredded coconut on top of your pizza. Before doing this, consider the tastes of those you’ll be serving. Some may not appreciate coconut as much as you do, so you may want to only sprinkle it over one half of the pizza. Preparing Berry Brownie Pizza Preheat your oven. Set your oven to 350°F (176°C) if you’re using a normal pizza pan or 325°F (163°C) if you’re using one that is dark or non-stick. Preheating generally takes 10 to 15 minutes, though this time may vary depending on your oven. Prepare the brownie mix. For the best result, follow the package directions to prepare the mix. Usually this combining the brownie mix with oil, eggs, and water in a bowl. Stir these ingredients thoroughly with a whisk until the mixture is consistent throughout. Pour the mix into a round pizza pan. Coat the bottom of your pizza pan with non-stick cooking spray or shortening. Pour the brownie mix into the pan. Use a wooden spoon to scrape mix remnants from the bowl to the pan. Spread the mix in an even layer. Bake the brownie. Insert the pan into your preheated oven. Bake the brownie for 25 to 28 minutes. As the baking time nears its end, check the brownie by sticking a toothpick into it 2 in (5 cm) from the edge of the pan. If the toothpick comes out nearly clean, the brownies are ready. Combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract. In a small mixing bowl, add the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla. Blend these ingredients with an electric mixer set to medium speed. Beat the ingredients with the mixer until it is smooth. Top your pizza with the cream cheese spread and berries. With an offset spatula or a knife, scoop the cream cheese mixture out of the bowl and layer it on top of the brownie. Spread the berries on top of the cream cheese mixture. Brush apple jelly on the berries and enjoy. Stir the apple jelly until it is smooth. Use a cooking brush to paint the berries with the jelly. Insert the brownie into the refrigerator for about an hour or until it is cool to the touch. Cut the brownie pizza into wedges and enjoy. Cover your brownie pizza and store it in your refrigerator. This desert should last about 3 to 4 days before going bad.
